app.appIndexPage:
<?php 
require_once("$_SERVER[DOCUMENT_ROOT]/../`--SecureFolder--`/admin/onlyLoggedIn.php");
require_once("$_SERVER[DOCUMENT_ROOT]/../php_library/sQuote.php");
/*
So, view data is defined as this 
obj 
'viewName':{
	funct:function that is a view function,
	title: either a string or a function that calculates the title,
	urlEndpoint: a url enpoint to be concatenated to `--AdminTopURI--`/,
	StartHistory: a function that accepts the top part of the url to act as data. 
}
*/
echo str_replace([
	'`--AdminSuperViewData--`',
	'`--AdminSuperRMFData--`',
	'`--AdminSuperCSS--`',
	'`--USERDATA--`'
],[
	(
		($_SESSION['`--AdminSessionVarName--`_role'] === 'super') ? '
		`--ManageAdminsPat--`;
		' : 
		""
	),
	(
		($_SESSION['`--AdminSessionVarName--`_role'] === 'super') ? '
		`--ManageAdminsRMFData--`;
		' : 
		""
	),
	(
		($_SESSION['`--AdminSessionVarName--`_role'] === 'super') ? '
		`--ManageAdminsCSS--`
		' : 
		""
	),
	json_encode([
		'name'=>$_SESSION['`--AdminSessionVarName--`_name'],
		'email'=>$_SESSION['`--AdminSessionVarName--`'],
		'role'=>$_SESSION['`--AdminSessionVarName--`_role'],
		'pk'=>$_SESSION['`--AdminSessionVarName--`_pk']
	])
],file_get_contents("$_SERVER[DOCUMENT_ROOT]/../`--SecureFolder--`/admin/app.html.temp"));

?>

general.title: Zehlm (Job)
general.description: At the beginning of working for Zehlm, I took on small projects. By the end of it, though, I was implementing large sections and trusted with wide swathes of discretion.

main.html:
Zehlm (Job)

Senior Full-Stack Developer

At the beginning of working for Zehlm, I took on small projects. By the end of it, though, I was implementing large sections and trusted with wide swathes of discretion. My responsibilities included:

  • Implementing APIs
  • Editing php Templates
  • Implementing Secure Login
  • Engineering and Implementing JavaScript Libraries

Related Languages
JavaScript
I did a lot of heavy lifting in the way of JavaScript Zehlm.
PHP
I had to both edit PHP templates, and produce clean PHP from scratch at Zehlm.
HTML
I had to read and implement clean HTML.
CSS
At Zehlm, I produced clean, and correct CSS.
HTACCESS
Every once in a while, I would have to implement clean HTACCESS for Zehlm
MySQL
I implemented MySQL for interacting with databases.

Related Projects
Church Website
Non Profit Membership Login
I supervised the transition from Memberstack 1.0 to 2.0. Implemented a content management system.
Sports Blog
Helped implement a content management system, and a user login (with comments).
Hunting Product Distributor
E-Commerce Implementation
LTL Shipping Provider
This had a complex user-login, where different types of user accounts would interact with each other in specific ways.

general.title: Real-Estate Application (Job)
general.description: This is a job I had creating a real-estate website.

main.html:
Real-Estate Application (Job)

Front-End Developer

This was a terrible experience. I met these guys off of Craigslist, and they were underwater. There was a salesman and a server guy. They passed the reigns to me, and I began working. I sent emails almost daily, with my progress.

I got to the stage of installing it on the server, and the server-side guy didn't understand it, but he refused to talk on the phone about it. He only wanted to email. He threw up his hands and refused to work on it.

It turned out that he hadn't been reading the emails. I had dozens of hours in it at this point. There were plenty of problems with what I had produced... definitely. But after the not reading, and the casting it aside, I left the project.

What I Learned

I learned how important reading communications is, and how important it is to ask questions when you don't understand something. I pressure myself to do this out of the golden rule. I strive to not act as if I already know it all... and to question myself.

Related Languages
JavaScript
HTML
CSS

Related Projects
Real Estate User Dashboard

general.title: PHP (Language)
general.description: PHP is my server side language. People talk trash about PHP, but I like it. I chose it because of the sentence: 'if they discontinued support for php, half the internet would die.' It seemed like a safe choice, in this tech landscape that shifts as much as it does.

main.html:
PHP (Language)

Lead Engineer

PHP is my server side language. People talk trash about PHP, but I like it. I chose it because of the sentence: 'if they discontinued support for php, half the internet would die.' It seemed like a safe choice, in this tech landscape that shifts as much as it does.

I love PHP because it was designed to be a server-side web language. Almost all of the day-to-day operations I need to host a site are *default* global functions. No import necessary. People also don't like the dollar sign on variables... but I can name my variable anything I want, and it doesn't pollute the function namespace.

Related Jobs
Zehlm
I had to both edit PHP templates, and produce clean PHP from scratch at Zehlm.
Web Apps Actualized
I love php.

Related Languages
JavaScript
PHP is sometimes used to manage which JavaScript libraries are being shipped to the client
HTML
A massive part of PHP is managing the emission of HTML.
CSS
PHP is sometimes used to manage which CSS libraries are being shipped to the client
HTACCESS
It seems strange to include HTACCESS with PHP, but I have used PHP to meta-code HTACCESS right much.
MySQL
PHP interacts with MySQL.
SQLite
PHP interacts with SQLite.
PostgreSQL
PHP interacts with PostgreSQL

general.title: SQLite (Language)
general.description: I have used SQLite a lot. I love it. I love that I can just  copy an SQLite database. I love how it is isolated from other databases.

main.html:
SQLite (Language)

I have used SQLite a lot. I love it. I love that I can just copy an SQLite database. I love how it is isolated from other databases. Every once in a while, I'll find myself reaching for some kind of behavior that MySQL has but SQLite doesn't... but all in all, it's an A+ from me.

Related Jobs
Web Apps Actualized
I have found great use out of the isolation that SQLite provides.

Related Languages
PHP
PHP interacts with SQLite.

Related Projects
Greg Goad .net V2
Site Generator
I use SQLite for a lot of the rendered data in the site generator.
Invoice to Inbox
SQLite makes installing the database on new instances a breeze, and it isolates instances from one another.
RMF Program Writer
Database Manager
The database manager can render interfaces into SQLite.

general.title: C++ (Language)
general.description: C++ was my first foray into computer programming. I'm just a beginner with C++.

main.html:
C++ (Language)

The date on this is misleading. It would seem that this would be my best language. That is not the case. I discovered C++ as a kid, and then went on a detour into music. I've ended up using C++ to write math programs, and a few Windows console programs. The one I use every day launches my server, and monitors a folder for commands from my local web apps.

general.title: Git (Language)
general.description: The more I use git, the more I love it.

main.html:
Git (Language)

Although git isn't a language per se, I chose to include it here: it is a system, with a series commands, to instruct a computer what to do to manage your. In many ways, I see git as a declarative language, pushed through the command line.

Here is a link to my GitHub

Lead Developer

RMF stands for 'Ready Made Form'. Of all the aspects of the Database Manager, this was the hardest to engineer. In retrospect, it seems simple.

This is a JS library that accepts a declarative list of 'RMF Input Objects' and uses it to produce a form, that is easy to collect and reset.

My Personal Site


My Blog

My Résumé

Integrity
Driven

Greg Goad

Full Stack Developer / Software Engineer

Contact
GregGoad.net
GitHub.com/ggoad
ggHireMe.com

Summary

A career musician turned programmer. Seeking to leverage 8 years of intense production in website development and single-page applications to contribute to an outstanding team. Can plan large, technical projects to be delivered on a deadline. A specialist in website performance optimization, frequently delivering a speed index of 1 second or less.

Work History

Full Stack Developer Zehlm Web Development

11/2022 - Present
(Remote) Morganton, NC
  • Integrated APIs, including Stripe and Google Maps, enhancing functionality for client projects.
  • Coached team members on techniques of performance optimization, increasing page performance scores to 90+.
  • Led a library re-factoring, centralizing re-used code and easing the difficultly of future edits.
  • Spearheaded the inclusion of single-page application dashboards, maximizing user-satisfaction, and cutting server blocking time by 1/3.
  • Engineered and executed a complicated application with 4 user login types, delivering deliverables for a client worth $10,000+.
  • Authored a library to split large files into pieces and sending the pieces to the server, increasing upload capacity by a factor of 10.
  • Communicated clear documentation for libraries and folder structures, eliminating the need for future communication on the subject.

Lead Software Engineer Web Apps Actualized

05/2016 - 10/2022
(Remote) Walnut Cove, NC
  • Constructed a suite of powerful tooling, reducing production time by many factors of 10.
    • VCR.js: Developed a minimalistic front-end application framework, reducing the server-load by up to 60% per page on the site.
    • Ready Made Form: Engineered and implemented a CRUD interface renderer, reducing interface production time from 8-10 hours to a mere 20-60 minutes, for entire databases.
    • Invoice to Inbox: Built accounting and business management software managing billing, payments, and report generation: increasing the client's perception of professionalism 2x.
    • The Daily Wizard: Founded an application to collect data and schedule work.
    • Site Generator: Designed a tool to meta-code websites based on a configuration form, eliminating 3-5 days of development time.
  • Optimized fully-functioning single-page applications as websites to score 99-100 across the board on Google Lighthouse.
  • Collaborated with other developers and communicated with clients to settle on solutions.
  • Implemented a dashboard for a REST API to check prices on a daily basis, saving the client thousands of dollars per year in lost revenue.

Front End DeveloperCheyenne Studios

02/2016 - 04/2016
(Remote) Las Angeles, CA
  • Collaborated via Slack with cross-functional teams of developers to troubleshoot and develop solutions to technical challenges.
  • Built a JavaScript calendar and organized server requests in such a way as to reduce query times by 50%.

  • JavaScript
  • PHP

adminAppIndexTemplate:
<?php 
require_once("$_SERVER[DOCUMENT_ROOT]/../`--SecureFolder--`/admin/onlyLoggedIn.php");
require_once("$_SERVER[DOCUMENT_ROOT]/../php_library/sQuote.php");
/*
So, view data is defined as this 
obj 
'viewName':{
	funct:function that is a view function,
	title: either a string or a function that calculates the title,
	urlEndpoint: a url enpoint to be concatenated to `--AdminTopURI--`/,
	StartHistory: a function that accepts the top part of the url to act as data. 
}
*/
echo str_replace([
	'`--AdminSuperViewData--`',
	'`--AdminSuperRMFData--`',
	'`--AdminSuperCSS--`',
	'`--USERDATA--`'
],[
	(
		($_SESSION['`--AdminSessionVarName--`_role'] === 'super') ? '
		`--ManageAdminsPat--`;
		' : 
		""
	),
	(
		($_SESSION['`--AdminSessionVarName--`_role'] === 'super') ? '
		`--ManageAdminsRMFData--`;
		' : 
		""
	),
	(
		($_SESSION['`--AdminSessionVarName--`_role'] === 'super') ? '
		`--ManageAdminsCSS--`
		' : 
		""
	),
	json_encode([
		'name'=>$_SESSION['`--AdminSessionVarName--`_name'],
		'email'=>$_SESSION['`--AdminSessionVarName--`'],
		'role'=>$_SESSION['`--AdminSessionVarName--`_role'],
		'pk'=>$_SESSION['`--AdminSessionVarName--`_pk']
	])
],file_get_contents("$_SERVER[DOCUMENT_ROOT]/../`--SecureFolder--`/admin/app.html.temp"));

?>
